articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon South Headquarters
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon South Headquarters
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), in a compatriotic atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 Present there were Chairman Choe Jin Su and officials of the North Headquarters of Pomminryon.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Algerian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Algerian President
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence.
					  He said in the message:
					
					 The Korean people are sincerely glad that the Algerian people have strengthened their national unity and made great achievements in the historic cause of building a new society after the independence of the country.
					
					 He wholeheartedly hoped that Algeria would achieve greater progress and prosperity, expressing conviction that the good friendly and cooperative relations with a long historical tradition between the two countries would steadily develop in the future.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Belarusian President Aleksandr Grigoriyevich Lukashenko on its national day.
					 Kim in the message wished him success in his work for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of the people.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would favorably develop.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Cape Verde
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on June 29 sent a message of greeting to Jorge Carlos Fonseca, president of Cape Verde, on the 37th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the Republic.
					 Kim in his message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily develop, sincerely wishing the president of Cape Verde bigger success in his work for the prosperity of the country and the people's welfare.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Delegation of International Organization
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Delegation of International Organization
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers headed by Secretary General Julien Huck who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Sweden Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Sweden Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Barbro Elm, Swedish ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell visit to him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Greek FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Greek FM
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Dimitris Avramopoulos upon his appointment as foreign minister of Greece.
					 The message wished him success in his new work.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Belarus
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets FM of Belarus
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to his Belorussian counterpart Sergei Nikolayevich Martinov on the national day of Belarus.
					 Pak in his message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets Algerian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets Algerian FM
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Mourad Medelci, foreign minister of Algeria, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries that have steadily developed on the basis of long history and good tradition would grow stronger in the future and wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: C.C., DFRK Issues Appeal to All Koreans
articles.content:
C.C., DFRK Issues Appeal to All Koreans 
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea issued an appeal to all Koreans on Wednesday, the 40th anniversary of the July 4 Joint Statement.
					 The July 4 Joint Statement the keynote of which is the Three Principles of National Reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity -- was published on July 4, 1972.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, on the basis of his scientific insight into the ardent desire of the fellow countrymen for reunification and the rapidly changing internal and external situation, provided north-south high-level political talks, wisely leading the work to ensure that the Three Principles of National Reunification were declared through the July 4 Joint Statement. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il provided the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, great programmes for reunification in the 21st century and the landmarks for independent reunification, peace and prosperity. This was a special event which opened up a new phase in the struggle to achieve the reunification of the country.
					
					 The Three Principles of National Reunification and the joint declarations based on them are the greatest crystal of the precious patriotic legacies for reunification left by the peerlessly great men, the appeal said.
					
					 It called for holding higher the banner of national independence in the struggle for national reunification and urged all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad to positively turn out in the struggle to implement the north-south joint declarations in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Le us not tolerate even the slightest move of foreign forces to interfere in the issue of Korea's reunification!
					
					 Let us wage a dynamic struggle to put an end to the U.S. military presence and domination over south Korea!
					
					 Le us all the fellow countrymen turn out to decisively foil the reckless moves of the U.S. and the south Korean belligerent forces to ignite a war against the DPRK!
					
					 Let us resolutely struggle against the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement (GSOMIA) between south Korea and Japan!
					
					 Let us thoroughly shatter the moves to establish the U.S.-Japan- south Korea triangular military alliance for aggression!
					
					 Let all Koreans unite close under the banner of reunification and patriotism irrespective of ideology, social system and ism!
					
					 Let us thoroughly shatter the racket of the pro-American conservative regime and the "Saenuri Party" for "eliminating forces following the north"! 
					
					 Let us positively support and encourage the south Korean people in their righteous struggle for protecting democracy and vital rights!
					
					 The Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea ardently called for glorifying this year as a historic year to shatter the desperate moves of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and bringing about a new turn in national reunification. 
					
					 It expressed belief that all the fellow countrymen would positively support and respond to this appeal.

articles.title: Joint Seminar of Koreans Held to Mark 40th Anniversary of July 4 Joint Statement
articles.content:
Joint Seminar of Koreans Held to Mark 40th Anniversary of July 4 Joint Statement
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar of Koreans in the north, south and abroad was held in Pyongyang, Seoul and Tokyo on Wednesday by way of fax transmission to mark the 40th anniversary of the July 4 Joint Statement.
					 At the seminar speeches were made under various titles including "On thoroughly adhering to and implementing the Three Principles of National Reunification and the north-south joint declaration", "July 4 Joint Statement and practical tasks in June 15 era" and "July 4 Joint Statement and tasks for anti-imperialist struggle in present phase".
					
					 The speakers said the July 4 Joint Statement serves as a grand program for reunification common to the nation the keynote of which is the issue of reunifying the country on the principles of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity, free from outside interference.
					
					 The Three Principles of National Reunification, solemnly made public at home and abroad through the July 4 Joint Statement, are a principal way for settling the issue of reunification by the Korean nation itself and an action program for the unity of the entire nation, they said.
					
					 The Three Principles of National Reunification were reaffirmed by the historic Pyongyang meeting and the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, demonstrating their validity, vitality, truth and attraction, they noted.
					
					 The only way for independent reunification lies in thoroughly preserving and implementing the Three Principles of National Reunification and the north-south declarations, they said. Therefore, all the compatriots should turn out as one to carry them out.
					
					 A joint resolution was adopted at the seminar.
					
					 All the theories inciting confrontation against reunification while negating the national reconciliation and reunification should be thoroughly smashed so that all sorts of confrontation measures should never be taken any more, it said.
					
					 It called for dealing a decisive defeat to the anti-reunification conservative forces who seek stay in power through the great national unity.
					
					 The resolution called on the organizations of various social strata in the north, south and abroad to turn out in the struggle to make a breakthrough to reunification, on the basis of the Three Principles of National Reunification and the north-south joint declaration.

articles.title: DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home (5)
articles.content:
DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home (5) 
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman Pak Jong Suk was interviewed by Korean and foreign reporters on June 28.
					 Referring to the motive of making up her mind to come back to the DPRK, she said:
					
					 I have never forgotten the DPRK during my stay in south Korea and always sought the way to come back to the DPRK. 
					
					 I made much effort to attain this purpose. But, I could not discuss it with any one in fear of disclosure. Every step needed money. I eagerly wanted to come back to the DPRK. I spent days in depressed mood in despair suffering from feelings of futility. 
					
					 In August last year, I watched on TV leader Kim Jong Il paying a historic visit to the Russian Federation. 
					
					 Seeing the leader visiting Siberia and Far East area of Russia for the people's happiness despite of his emaciated body, I bitterly hated myself wandering about in dirty ditch after betraying the motherland. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il took care of my family with a complicated background without discrimination and sent a birthday spread to my mother on her 70th birthday. My son graduated from Pyongyang University of Music and Dance and became a teacher there. He also highly appreciated my younger brother. Thinking of what I was doing in south Korea, far from repaying the benevolence shown by the leader, it seemed my heart would break apart. 
					
					 Regretting my hesitation, I renewed my determination to come to the DPRK at any cost even though I lose my life on the way. 
					
					 In December last year, news of Kim Jong Il's untimely passing away on a train while devoting himself to the welfare of our people came like a thunderbolt from the blue. I could not but burst out sobbing looking up to the sky above the motherland. 
					
					 I was going to come back to his embrace and beg pardon on my knees. I made up my mind to come to the DPRK at the cost of my life and be buried in the homeland. 
					
					 My whole soul was directed to the DPRK and I had nothing to fear.
					
					 I shook off the surveillance of agents of the puppet Intelligence Service and departed the cursed south Korean land and came back to the DPRK, motherland.

articles.title: Delegation of International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers Visits Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers headed by Secretary General Julien Huck visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They looked round the historic relics, being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his family members.
					
					 They then visited the revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 The delegation also toured the e-library at Kim Il Sung University, Tower of the Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Three-Revolution Exhibition, Hana Musical Information Centre, the armed spy ship of the U.S. imperialists "Pueblo" and other places.

articles.title: Workers Vow to Uphold Kim Jong Un's Songun Revolutionary Leadership with Loyalty
articles.content:
Workers Vow to Uphold Kim Jong Un's Songun Revolutionary Leadership with Loyalty
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- An oath-taking meeting of trade union members and other workers took place before the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid a floral basket, bouquets and flowers before the statues and made bows.
					
					 They in a letter of pledge to the dear respected Kim Jong Un praised the immortal feats made by the President whom the Korean people acclaimed and held in high esteem for the first time in the nation's 5 000-year-long history.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche, the Songun revolutionary cause, pioneered by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, they noted.
					
					 The speaker stressed the need to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started on Mt. Paektu, true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Confers Doctorate on Chief of the Institute of Technology of Yanbian University of China
articles.content:
DPRK Confers Doctorate on Chief of the Institute of Technology of Yanbian University of China
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Choe Mun Il, chief of the Institute of Technology of Yanbian University of China, received a doctorate of the DPRK.
					 He studied the structural diagram suitable for the quake-proof high-rise building of steel structure and its seismic analysis and contributed to the completion of the quake-proof structure design.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: 51 DPRK Players Qualified for 30th Olympiad
articles.content:
51 DPRK Players Qualified for 30th Olympiad
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- 51 players of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have won qualification for the 30th Olympic Games, with two added to the women's boxing and men's diving events recently.
					 The DPRK players are to compete in eleven events, including women's football, marathon, table tennis, judo, wrestling, weightlifting, shooting, archery and synchronized swimming.

articles.title: Korea Education Fund
articles.content:
Korea Education Fund
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Korea Education Fund (KEF) is gaining momentum in its activities.
					 In this regard, KCNA met President Chae Ryang Il and Secretary General Ko Song Ryol of the Fund.
					
					 Q: Please tell me about the activities of the KEF.
					
					 Chae: Its activities cover construction and renovation of schools, cooperation and exchange of teachers in foreign languages education, promotion of children's health, improvement of home economics labs, support to production of textbooks and references and supply of modern educational facilities.
					
					 Last year, the Fund rendered assistance to renovating five flood-damaged schools and improved educational facilities in scores of schools.
					
					It supplied food and daily necessities to more than ten schools, while organizing teachers' regular courses on several occasions.
					
					 In recent years, the Project Approval Committee of the Fund approved scores of proposals after making deliberations of them. The approval led to implementation of more than 40 assistance projects.
					
					 The KEF issues annual reports, conducting information activities through mass media.
					
					 The website run by the Fund is www.koredufund.org.kp.
					
					 Q: It is said that the KEF has received support from many foreign agencies and organizations. Can you tell me about it?
					
					 Ko: The KEF has closely cooperated with many foreign donors. It made agreements on some assistance projects with foreign donor agencies, including the Light Foundation of Canada, Foundation for Micro-projects in Vietnam-DPRK (FMV-DPRK), Friends in Education of Canada, Maranatha Trust Group of Australia, Russkiy Mir Foundation of Russia and Secours Populaire Francais and Manna Mission Europe of Great Britain.
					
					 In the last six years alone, the KEF conducted activities for improving educational facilities and studying and living conditions and supporting the promotion of children's health at nearly 200 educational establishments of different levels.

articles.title: Inhabitants of Changjon Street Grateful to Kim Jong Un for New House
articles.content:
Inhabitants of Changjon Street Grateful to Kim Jong Un for New Houses
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Removal to new houses is going on in Changjon Street, Pyongyang.
					 The new inhabitants are grateful to the dear respected Kim Jong Un for their nice houses provided by the state free of charge. 
					
					 Choe Jong Hui, 51, whose family moved into a new flat in block 9, Kyongsang-dong, told KCNA:
					
					 "The state gave this new house to me before anyone else as I am a demobilized officer.
					
					 My son, a student of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, was awarded the Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize some time ago.
					
					 Soldier-builders and government officials have often visited my house to learn about any inconvenience in the new house.
					
					 I'll bring up my children to be soldiers faithful to the dear respected Kim Jong Un's guidance over the Songun (military first) revolution."
					
					 Ri Tong Hyok, an officer of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, said:
					
					 "We had devoted all our wisdom and energies to the construction of this street from its start, with determination to fully discharge our mission and role as servicepersons for the people as instructed by our Supreme Commander.
					
					 So, people moving into new houses are expressing deep thanks to the servicepersons.
					
					  But, it is just the dear respected Kim Jong Un that should get such thanks from them. He is working heart and soul to make all the people enjoy all kinds of benefits under socialism."

articles.title: Termination of Armistice Urged
articles.content:
Termination of Armistice Urged
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Korean Peninsula has been reduced to the world's most volatile region with the cold war era structure still remaining due to the United States keeping up the state of armistice.
					 In this regard, Dr. Hwang Myong Chol at the Academy of Social Sciences told KCNA:
					
					 The Korean War, started on June 25, 1950, has not yet ended.
					
					 Pursuant to the Armistice Agreement (AA), the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is still at a state of war with the United States. This evidently show what option the DPRK should take.
					
					 Ambitious U.S. munitions monopolies are trying to expand weaponry market. In the 21st century, the U.S. has attached priority to the Asia-pacific region for its world's strategic hegemony.
					
					 It is the U.S. calculation that maintenance of the cold war era structure in the region can help fatten the U.S. munitions businesses.
					
					 Therefore, the U.S. has turned blind eyes to the DPRK proposal for replacing AA with a peace accord. It has formed a triangular military alliance with south Korea and Japan, tightening military pressure upon the DPRK.
					
					 Recently, it staged a firing drill with the DPRK flag as the target under the scenario to stifle the DPRK with all military means including nuclear weapons.
					
					 It is quite natural exercise of the right to self-defence for the DPRK to counter the U.S. persistent anti-DPRK policy and intensified military pressure with its increased nuclear deterrent.
					
					 After all, to replace the AA with a peace accord is a prerequisite to peace and prosperity of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Myth of U.S. "Mightiness" Shattered in Korean War
articles.content:
Myth of U.S. "Mightiness" Shattered in Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The myth of the "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists was exploded in the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953) for the first time in history.
					 It was entirely attributable to President Kim Il Sung's military wisdom.
					
					 The President always countered the aggressors with offensive spirit and unparalleled courage and grit.
					
					 His Juche-based war tactics resulted in the liberation of the city of Seoul three days after the outbreak of the war and sinking of a U.S. heavy cruiser, called "moving islet in the sea", by attack of only four torpedo boats.
					
					 An advance unit of the so-called U.S. "undefeated division" was annihilated at a stroke, attacked by a unit of the Korean People's Army. KPA units broke through in two days the enemy defence line built along the River Kum as "the line of no retreat". The commander of the "undefeated division" was arrested by a young KPA soldier in a battle in Taejon City.
					
					 In a nutshell, the war brought about the beginning of decline for the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: New Book Published in DPRK
articles.content:
New Book Published in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Book "Leader and Ryu Kyong Su" was published in the DPRK.
					 The book consists of 5 chapters.
					
					 The book impressively portrays the boundless love for comrades of President Kim Il Sung who put forth the philosophy on comrade and comradely love for the first time in history and led the revolution to victory on its basis.
					
					 It carries facts showing the faithfulness of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter Ryu Kyong Su who became an excellent revolutionary and enjoyed a worthwhile life under the benevolent care of the President. 
					
					 Ryu Kyong Su, a son of a farmhand, embarked upon the road of revolution, and was brought up to be a brave anti-Japanese fighter and genuine revolutionary under the care of the President.
					
					 He made a signal contribution to the founding of regular armed forces in the country after its liberation and to the historic victory in the Fatherland Liberation War by conducting distinguished activities.
					
					 He totally dedicated himself to defending the country after the war.
					
					 The President showed warm benevolence to Hwang Sun Hui, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter, and other family members of Ryu Kyong Su after his death.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Publishing Bureau of the DPRK issued a new stamp (sheet) in commemoration of the erection of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Seen on the upper part of the stamp are words "The statues of the great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il erected on Mansu Hill" and the date of the erection "April 13, Juche 101 (2012)".
					
					 The stamp portrays the statues against the background of the Korean Revolution Museum. 
					
					 Also seen on the stamp are floral baskets laid before the statues, fireworks displayed in the sky and slogans reflecting the firm will of all the service persons and other people of the DPRK.
					
					 The stamp clearly shows their unshakable will to eternally hold in high esteem the peerlessly great men and successfully accomplish the cause of the sun under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S.-south Korea Joint War Drill
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S.-south Korea Joint War Drill 
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. forces together with south Korean puppet troops staged the largest-ever joint live-shell firing drill in Phochon, Kyonggi Province, not far from the Military Demarcation Line. 
					 The drill was followed by a large-scale joint military maneuver involving lots of war hardware including the U.S. nuclear-powered carrier George Washington.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined article in this regard: Those military drills were, in fact, staged under the simulated conditions of a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK in seas, ground and the air. 
					
					 They were timed to coincide with June 25, the day when the Korean War broke out. They were a preliminary war making the ignition of another Korean war on the Korean Peninsula an established fact, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. claimed they were regular drills aimed at coping with someone's "infiltration" and "provocation" and retaliating against them, but such rhetoric can never work in this bright world. It is nothing but a shameless sophism that a burglar should be allowed to "beat" and "punish" the master of a house. 
					
					 The joint live-shell firing drill was an extremely dangerous provocation heralding the start of a war, going beyond the phase of threat to the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. is seeking to strike the DPRK by a surprise preemptive attack on it to occupy the whole of Korea as it did in the Korean War in the last century. 
					
					 The military and technical superiority is not a monopoly of the U.S. and gone are the days never to return when the U.S. could threaten and blackmail the DPRK with A-bombs. 
					
					 The persistent U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK will compel its army and people to bolster up the nuclear deterrent for self-defence to frustrate it.

articles.title: Japanese Defense Minister's War Drumbeats Slammed by Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japanese Defense Minister's War Drumbeats Slammed by Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- New Japanese Defense Minister Morimoto made bellicose remarks at a meeting of the Foreign Relations and Defense Committee of the House of Councilors. He said that Japan needs to acquire the capability to attack enemy bases to prevent ballistic missile "attack" by other countries. He also said that to attack enemy bases comes within the scope of "self-defense" in the light of international law and the interpretation of the Japan Constitution.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 These reckless remarks which his predecessors dared not to let loose were made without hesitation by a guy who was a mere scholar. But lurking behind his outbursts was a sinister aim.
					
					 By echoing the voices of Japanese politicians he sought to repay the trust they reposed in him and win popularity, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The theory on "having access to the capability to attack enemy bases" is, in essence, aimed to get capability to mount a preemptive attack and, furthermore, turn the country into a war state.
					
					  It is the biggest focal point of the Japanese political circles to have access to the capability to make a preemptive attack on other countries and gain the right of belligerency, the right to participate in a war and the right to collective self-defense.
					
					 Japan is rushing headlong into undisguised nuclear weaponization after abandoning even the "three non-nuclear principles."
					
					 Japan was unable to breathe a big breath even once for its past war crimes, only frequenting an alley. Now it went the lengths of trying to sponsor even a joint international military exercise.
					
					 Japan's only target is the DPRK. It is the scenario of Japan to make its first step forward in its militarist overseas aggression by mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 Those who are very sensitive of this tendency of the Japanese political circles are getting desperate to satisfy their political greed.  Their heavyweights are appointing anyone they deem helpful to their policy of militarist overseas expansion.
					
					 The peace-loving people of the world should decisively foil Japan's moves for turning itself into a military giant and launching overseas expansion.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces Lee Myung Bak for Hurling Mud at DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces Lee Myung Bak for Hurling Mud at DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea was reported to have hurled mud at the DPRK during his tour of Central and South American countries. 
					 Citing the Cheonan warship case, a charade against the DPRK, he said that south Korea would "not allow any provocation by the north" and that "any provocation would entail severer punishment". 
					
					 He was busy slandering compatriots and kicking up a racket to stifle the DPRK, not content with confrontation hysteria at home. 
					
					 This cannot but be shame on the nation as it brings to light the true colors of Lee as a confrontation maniac obsessed with sycophancy towards the U.S. 
					
					 The hysteric action of rat-like Myung Bak is nothing but the last-ditch efforts to hide his disgusting image as the worst traitor, regarding dependence on outsiders and confrontation with compatriots as his means of existence, and prolong his miserable remaining days. 
					
					 He is now finding himself in the worst crisis, repudiated by all people for dashing the desire of the nation for peace and reunification and bedeviling the north-south relations. 
					
					 South Korean people from all walks of life bitterly denounce the "policy of pragmatism" pursued by Lee as a  totally failed policy of confrontation and a traitorous policy whereby he sold off the interests of the nation and right of south Korean people to existence.
					
					 The cascade of invectives let loose by Lee Myung Bak against fellow countrymen even abroad is a vivid expression of his consciousness of the crisis into which he has been driven after becoming a target of the people's punishment. 
					
					 Lee was so obsessed with pro-Americanism that he behaved so foolishly, unaware of the atmosphere in the region, to say nothing of his political sense. 
					
					 The flames of the anti-U.S. actions are raging more furiously in  Latin America, once called "tranquil backyard" of the U.S., than in any other regions. 
					
					 In December last year leaders of 33 states in Latin America and Caribbean region established a new community, rejecting the U.S. in reflection of the will to let the region play a bigger role in the international arena in the future. 
					
					 The recent General Assembly of the Organization of American States (OAS) declared that it would put an end to the present system of the body by reforming the U.S.-led OAS. 
					
					 Lee Myung Bak toured such region to echo the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and was busy with his sycophancy towards the U.S. Clear were its consequences. 
					
					 He was talkative about "summit diplomacy" and the like in a bid to improve his image. But, his behavior as a politician more dead than alive and pro-U.S. stooge, only sparked off ridicule and repugnance among people in the region and in the international community. 
					
					 All facts prove once again the urgent need to throw overboard such traitor as rat-like Myung Bak.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean "Government's" Moves to Conclude GSOMIA with Japan
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean "Government's" Moves to Conclude GSOMIA with Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- There is a political storm in south Korea in the wake of the action taken to put off the conclusion of the General Security of Military Information Agreement (GSOMIA) with Japan. 
					 The south Korean "government's" attempt to clinch the signing of GSOMIA in secret without passing through the "National Assembly" went bust. 
					
					 It was fully disclosed that this treachery was sponsored by Chongwadae (presidential office). The Defense Ministry and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade of south Korea had got aboard the same boat with Chongwadae. But, now they are busy shifting the responsibility for this onto one another. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group tried to conclude an agreement for military alliance with Japan. However, it could not but step back for fear of punishment by history and nation. 
					
					 The conclusion of the controversial agreement would mean the first agreement for military cooperation ever to be signed with Japan since the end of World War II. 
					
					 Political, press and social circles in south Korea are strongly protesting against the Lee group's unhesitant military nexus with Japan. 
					
					 Japan is persistently shunning sincere apology and reparation for its past thrice-cursed crimes committed against the Korean nation. It is watching for a chance of aggression, raising a claim to Tok Islets, an open disclosure of its wild ambition for staging a comeback to Korea. 
					
					 The conclusion of the agreement with Japan means paving a way for the Japanese militarist forces' reinvasion of Korea. 
					
					 That was why the preceding ruling quarters of south Korea dared not attempt to conclude any military agreement with Japan. 
					
					 Nevertheless, Lee Myung Bak attempted to conclude the agreement in great haste by setting in motion his mandarins of Chongwadae. This tells that he is the worst traitor putting the "five traitors of 1905" into the shade. 
					
					 The U.S. is behind Lee's operation. 
					
					  The U.S. has egged the Lee group on to sign a military agreement with Japan in real earnest for several years. 
					
					 The U.S. has considered the military nexus between the U.S. and south Korea along with military ties between the U.S. and Japan and between Japan and south Korea as a key link in the chain efforts to round off the tri-angular military alliance. Hence, the U.S. has so far pressurized south Korea to sign the agreement with Japan as early as possible. 
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the U.S. and south Korea held the two-plus-two ministerial security talks on June 14 at which they released a joint statement on the above-said military alliance. 
					
					 The U.S. main goal is to complete the formation of the tri-angular military alliance in a bid to carry out its strategy for dominating the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia. 
					
					 This is the reason why sharing information about the DPRK is the main contents of the agreement. 
					
					 The attempt for signing GSOMIA fully lays bare the true aim of the Lee group to do harm to fellow countrymen and realize its scenario for invading the north in reliance upon outside forces. 
					
					 Lee Myung Bak has already been sentenced to death as far as his fate as a politician is concerned. Yet, he is committing such high treason as making Koreans fall victim to outside forces. 
					
					 The Lee group of traitors is the root cause of bringing disasters to the Korean nation. 
					
					 All Koreans should never allow the moves to conclude GSOMIA with Japan but eradicate the root cause of their misfortune in good time.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities to Arrest Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon South Headquarters
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities to Arrest Vice-Chairman of Pomminryon South Headquarters
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean public security authorities declared that they would arrest Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), immediately after his return to south Korea on charges of the violation of the notorious "Security Law", according to the KBS of south Korea on Tuesday.
					 The authorities threatened that they would arrest Ro, who visited the north without the "government" permission and encouraged and praised the north.
					
					 On the day, the South Headquarters of Pomminryon held a press conference. Ro's visit to Pyongyang to participate in the memorial service to mark the 100th day since the demise of leader Kim Jong Il was the due etiquette for a member of the same nation, it said, denouncing the authorities' attempt to punish him on charges of the violation of law as an act of violating the spirit of the joint declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Government Authorities Accused of Covering up Japan's Past Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Accused of Covering Up Japan's Past Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations in south Korea denounced the "government" authorities for working hard to conclude a military agreement with Japan, which committed indelible crimes against the Korean nation.
					 The Federation of Anti-Japanese Independence Movement Organizations in a statement on June 28 said that an attempt to conclude a military agreement with Japan, keen to grab Tok Islets far from making apology and reparation for the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army and other crimes, is little short of covering up its past crimes.
					
					 The federation urged the "government" to stop at once the moves to conclude the agreement.
					
					 The Kwangbok Association in a statement on the same day denounced Japan for refusing to make apology and reparation for having invaded Korea and perpetrated massacres and plunder in the past.
					
					 The association demanded Japan halt its reckless acts.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Carried by Bulletin of Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Carried by Bulletin of Bulgarian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A detailed gist of Volumes 2 and 7 (Continuing Edition) of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" was carried by bulletin No. 5 of the Bulgaria－Korea Friendship Association.
					 The bulletin carried a portrait of the smiling President.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included meetings for remembering him in Myanmar and Romania and a seminar on his feats in Nigeria on June 27 and 28.
					
					 Aung Thein Lynn, member of the Central Executive Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said Kim Il Sung will always be remembered by the Korean people and the world progressives for his great feats for the country's prosperity and people's happiness and global independence.
					
					 The president developed the Workers' Party of Korea into a force guiding socialism, deeply rooted among the popular masses and strictly based on them, he said.
					
					 The President's feats and idea on party building were successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, praised Kim Il Sung as an outstanding statesman who devoted all his life to the people's freedom and happiness, the country's reunification and victory of global independence.
					
					 Though Kim Il Sung passed away, the Korean people highly praise and revere him as the great father of the nation, eternal President of the DPRK and the shining sun, he said, adding the dear respected Kim Jong Un inherited the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and is wisely leading the Korean people's effort for the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 Aba Sadik Abubakr, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, said Kim Il Sung glorified the 20th century as a century of the cause of independence against imperialism and socialist cause.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Will Shine Forever: Bangladeshi Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Will Shine Forever: Bangladeshi Figure
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, on June 26 issued a statement to mark the 18th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 He recollected with deep emotion the feats Kim Il Sung performed for the human cause of independence with his rare wisdom, outstanding ideological and theoretical activities and extraordinary political caliber.
					
					 The President was an outstanding statesman who had successfully led the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle and the world socialist movement, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea, Songun idea in his lifetime since he embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years.
					
					 The feats performed by the President in the Korean revolution and the world revolution will shine forever, he noted.
					
					 He expressed his belief that the Korean people would emerge victorious in the struggle for the country's reunification and the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Book, Photo and Fine Art Exhibitions Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Book, Photo and Fine Art Exhibitions Held in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK book, photo and fine art exhibitions took place in Mexico, Indonesia and South Africa between June 14 and 22 on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Seen in the venues were photos showing undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 On display there were their works and books, photos and fine art works introducing achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico said that he took part in the celebrations of the centenary of the President's birth, the Day of the Sun, and saw for himself the inexhaustible might of the army and people of the DPRK rallied close around their leader.
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a political, ideological and military power and socialist bulwark thanks to the President and Kim Jong Il, he noted, adding that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people are pushing forward the building of a thriving nation, single-mindedly united around the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The general secretary expressed conviction that the Songun revolutionary cause is sure to win.
					
					 The visitors to the photo exhibition in South Africa were unanimous in saying that it offered an opportunity to know better about the greatness of the DPRK. Kim Jong Il was a great leader who developed the WPK into a tested and veteran party, they noted.
					
					 The WPK always remains invincible and the future of the thriving DPRK will be brighter as it is led by Kim Jong Un, the creditable successor to Kim Jong Il's cause, they stressed.

articles.title: June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Supported by U.S. Organization
articles.content:
June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Supported by U.S. Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The North American Group for Study of the Juche and Songun Philosophy issued a statement on June 15 to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 June 15 is a significant day always remembered by all the Korean people as they declared a dynamic advance for reunification with sufferings from the country's division lasting for over half a century due to the U.S. imperialists, the statement said.
					
					 That day in 2000 leader Kim Jong Il, together with President Kim Dae Jung of south Korea, declared the will to put an end to the confrontation between compatriots caused by foreign forces and reunify Korea, it stressed.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" that Korea is for the Korean people, not slaves of aggressors, has become a banner of Korea's reunification, it said.
					
					 Great progress was made in the development of the north-south relations and the reunification movement after the adoption of the joint declaration, it said. But the movement for Korea's reunification has faced difficulties since rat-like Lee Myung Bak, a stooge of the U.S., took office, it said, and continued:  
					
					 The spirit of the June 15 declaration is being defamed and the danger of a new war is increasing owing to the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean group of traitors. The joint declaration reflects the unanimous aspiration of all Koreans.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly reunify the country. 
					
					 We voice full solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle.

articles.title: "The Flower Girl" Is World Masterpiece: Chinese Media
articles.content:
"The Flower Girl" Is World Masterpiece: Chinese Media
						
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Chinese media gave wide publicity to "The Flower Girl", one of the DPRK's revolutionary operas, lauding it as a world-famous masterpiece, fantastic and mesmerizing.
					 The DPRK's artistes had a successful performance tour of different parts of China from June 15 to 27. 
					
					 A Chinese Internet homepage said:
					
					 The story "The Flower Girl" was created by President Kim Il Sung in the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il personally led the adaptation of the story for opera in the 1970s, guiding the creation of every scene and music of the opera.
					
					 Through the groaning people's bitter tears, the opera gives a profound idea that making the revolution is the only way-out.
					
					 The opera is recognized as a world-famous masterpiece for its rich ideological contents and high artistry.
					
					 The homepage said that under the tested leadership of peerlessly great men, the Phibada-style revolutionary operas were created in the DPRK and the Phibada Opera Troupe made shining successes, evoking a lively response among people across the world.
					
					 Another Internet homepage of China said that the DPRK operas exert special influence and such graceful, elegant and dynamic group dances as those in the operas can never seen in any other country.
					
					 Lanzhou Daily in an article titled "The DPRK opera 'The Flower Girl' mesmerizes the whole audience" said that verse-songs and melodies of the opera were popular and fine stage background left great impact on the people.
					
					 Chongqing Wanbao said that unlike West operas with only songs, the DPRK opera introduced dance, presenting unique ground of opera art. Graceful and beautiful dance of good ensemble can not be seen in other part of the world.
					
					  Huaxi Dushibao carried an article titled "Song of the DPRK opera 'The Flower Girl' resounded in Chengdu" praised the influence of the opera.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Ro Su Hui
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Ro Su Hui
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio este miercoles en un ambiente fraternal en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Ro Su Hui, vicepresidente de la Direccion Surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion el presidente Choe Jin Su y otros funcionarios de la Direccion Nortena de la APRP.

articles.title: Ro Su Hui se entrevista con ACNC con motivo de su regreso
articles.content:
Ro Su Hui se entrevista con ACNC con motivo de su regreso
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Ro Su Hui, vicepresidente de la Direccion Surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria (APRP), se entrevisto el dia 3 con la ACNC en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang con motivo de su regreso al Sur de Corea tras cumplir su programa de estancia en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Vine a Pyongyang para participar en el acto de recordacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il por el 100o dia de su deceso, comenzo Ro y continuo:
					
					Tras tomar la decision de realizar una visita para expresar pesame ante el feretro del Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional y contribuir, aunque sea en lo minimo, a la mejora de las empeoradas relaciones entre el Sur y el Norte de Corea, la Direccion Surena de la APRP presento la solicitud de visita al Norte de Corea al "Ministerio de Reunificacion" que la ha negado.
					
					Por eso, segun la resolucion de la Direccion Surena, tuve que salir al tercer pais burlando las medidas de bloqueo de las autoridades.
					
					Durante mi estancia en la RPDC, he participado en las festividades del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, que centraron gran atencion del mundo, y otros actos solemnes como la celebracion del Dia Internacional de la Infancia.
					
					He recorrido el campamento secreto del monte Paektu, la zona del monte Kumgang, la central hidroelectrica no.2 de Huichon, la reconstruida avenida Changjon, fabricas y zonas rurales, ciudades y poblados.
					
					En esos dias, he conocido de primera mano que el Norte, donde estan unidos monoliticamente el Dirigente y el pueblo, construira sin falta un Estado prospero apoyandose en su estabilidad politica y gran potencialidad economica.
					
					En el suelo patrio del Norte, el pueblo es cielo y los ninos son reyes y la unidad monolitica es lo mas temible que el arma nuclear.
					
					Los compatriotas norcoreanos siguen y confian en el Comandante Supremo, quien aprecia al pueblo como cielo y practica la politica de amor al pueblo y a las generaciones venideras, considerandolo como padre.
					
					Ademas, no perdonan jamas a quien se atreve a difamar su maxima dignidad.
					
					Todos los norcoreanos, con que me reuni, viven con la fe y esperanza y desean con ansiedad la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Estoy dispuesto a luchar hasta el final con las autoridades conservadoras que tratan de imponerme cargos injustos.
					
					No hice nada bochornoso ante la nacion y la historia y volvere el dia 5 via Phanmunjom al concluir mi agenda de visita al Norte.
					
					Voy a contar a los hombres enganados por la demagogia de los medios conservadores de prensa del Sur de Corea todo lo que he visto, oido y experimentado en el Norte.
					
					Igualmente, delatare a todo el mundo los crimenes de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion.
					
					Ofrendare mi vida para defender y ejecutar la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, atajos a la reconciliacion, la paz y la prosperidad de la nacion.

articles.title: Llamamiento de FDRP a toda la nacion coreana
articles.content:
Llamamiento de FDRP a toda la nacion coreana
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 40o aniversario de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 4 de Julio, el Comite Central del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria hizo publico el dia 4 un llamamiento a todos los coreanos.
					El 4 de julio de 1972, quedo publicada la Declaracion Conjunta del 4 de Julio consistente en los Tres Principios de la Reunificacion de la Patria: la independencia, la reunificacion pacifica y la gran unidad nacional.
					
					Al percatarse de la ferviente aspiracion de todos los coreanos a la reunificacion y la situacion interna y externa que se cambiaba bruscamente, el Presidente Kim Il Sung preparo las conversaciones politicas de alto nivel N-S y dirigio sabiamente para promulgar los tres principios arriba mencionados a traves de la declaracion conjunta del 4 de julio.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il preparo la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, gran programa de reunificacion del siglo XXI y jalon de la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad, lo que constituyo un evento trascendental que permite preparar una nueva etapa alta para lograr la causa de reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Tales tres principios y las historicas declaraciones conjuntas N-S son preciosas herencias patrioticas para la reunificacion registradas por los grandes Hombres sin iguales.
					
					El documento se refiere a que para realizar la reintegracion territorial todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar deben enarbolar mas alto la bandera de la independencia nacional y levantarse en la lucha por materializar las declaraciones conjuntas N-S bajo el ideal de entre nosotros, los connacionales y continua:
					
					!No toleremos jamas cualesquier intenciones de las fuerzas foraneas de intervenir en el asunto de reunificacion de Corea!
					
					!Luchemos activamente por acabar con la ocupacion y dominacion militares de EE.UU. al Sur de Corea!
					
					!Levantemonos todos los coreanos para rechazar rotundamente las imprudentes maniobras de provocacion de guerra de agresion al Norte de los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos!
					
					!Luchemos activamente contra la concertacion del acuerdo de proteccion integral de la informacion militar Sur de Corea-Japon!
					
					!Frustremos  cabalmente el establecimiento de la agresiva alianza militar tripartita entre EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea!
					
					!Que toda la nacion coreana se una y se una bajo la bandera patriotica de reunificacion por encima de las diferencias de las ideas y regimenes, ideales e insistencias en ismos!
					
					!Frustremos totalmente los alborotos de la "purga de las fuerzas pro-Norte" del conservador "poder" pro-yanqui y el "Partido Saenuri"!
					
					!Apoyemos activamente la justa lucha de los habitantes surcoreanos por defender la democracia y el  derecho a vivir!
					
					Exhortando a toda la nacion coreana a hacer del presente ano un ano historico para frustrar las persistentes maniobras de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion  del interior y el exterior del pais y registrar un nuevo cambio en la realizacion de la reunificacion de la patria, el CC del FDRP expreso la conviccion de que todos los connacionales lo  apoyaran y lo respaldaran.

articles.title: Texto integro de la rueda de prensa concedida por Pak Jong Suk (5)
articles.content:
Texto integro de la rueda de prensa concedida por Pak Jong Suk (5)
						
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- En la conferencia de prensa concedida el 28 de junio con los medios nacionales y extranjeros, Pak Jong Suk, quien volvio a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea desde el Sur de Corea adonde habia sido raptada y llevada, explico el motivo que le hizo decidir el regreso a la patria. 
					Todo el tiempo que estuve en el Sur de Corea, nunca olvide a la RPDC y pense siempre en como volver a ella, comenzo Pak y prosiguio:
					
					A pesar de estar angustiada por ese tema, ni siquiera pude desahogarme por el miedo a que delataran mi plan de regreso. 
					
					Cuando vivia melancolica impotente de buscar la manera de regresar, he visto por la television en agosto del ano pasado la imagen del Dirigente     Kim Jong Il realizando una visita historica a la Federacion Rusa.
					
					Mirando al Dirigente que viajo hasta a las regiones de Siberia y el Extremo Oriente para la felicidad del pueblo sin hacer caso de su salud deteriorada, maldije mil veces a mi misma que abandone la patria y cai en la sucia sociedad surcoreana.
					
					Pasaron por mi mente los favores que el hizo a nuestra familia sin cuestionar los antecedentes complicados de mis familiares.
					
					El envio los alimentos para el septuagesimo cumpleanos de mi madre, hizo trabajar a mi hijo, graduado de la Universidad de Musica y Danza de Pyongyang (entonces), como profesor de este plantel y evaluo mucho a mi hermano menor.
					
					En diciembre del ano pasado, tuve noticia del fallecimiento inesperado del Dirigente en el tren en pleno viaje de trabajo.
					
					Rompi a llorar dirigiendome hacia la patria pensando como fue posible eso.
					
					Es que pensaba pedir disculpas de rodillas al Dirigente cuando lograra volver a la patria.
					
					Cuando redoble la decision de regresar sin falta, no hubo nada que temer.
					
					Asi pude salir del maldito suelo surcoreano burlando la vigilancia de los agentes del Servicio de Inteligencia y volver a mi patria, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.

articles.title: Cerrada la nomina de jugadores con boletos a los XXX juegos olimpicos
articles.content:
Cerrada la nomina de jugadores con boletos a los XXX juegos olimpicos
						
　Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo completada la lista de los jugadores coreanos clasificados para los XXX Juegos Olimpicos.
					　Hace poco, obtuvieron el boleto una boxeadora y un clavadista, con lo que suman 51 los deportistas que representaran a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en la magna cita estival.
					
					　Ellos competiran por las medallas en 11 disciplinas, tales como el futbol femenino, maraton, ping pong, judo, lucha, levantamiento de pesas, tiro, tiro al arco y nado sincronizado.
